Dialogs


LexGUI allows to create Dialogs, also known as modal windows or pop-ups, allowing developers to display important information, gather user input, or prompt for user actions without navigating away from the current context. The possible dialogs are the following:

  • Classic General pop-up to display any kind of information or errors.
  • Pocket: Tiny dialog used normally as a debugging tool. Can be docked to the window corners.
  • Prompt: Classic prompt pop-up to gather user information.

To fill the dialog content, a panel is automatically created inside the root so it's possible to begin branching and adding widgets. The same way as menubars, you can fill the panel inside the creation callback. The following code creates a classic dialog:

const dialog = new LX.Dialog("Title", p => {
    // Start adding widgets
    p.addNumber("Example", 18);
}, options);

// To use classic dialogs as simple messages or error alerts, they can be also created using LX.message
const dialog =  LX.message("Some text", "Title", options);

To create a Pocket Dialog you can follow the same steps but using LX.PocketDialog class. In case of prompts, you can create them using the following code:

LX.prompt("Message", "Title", (result) => {
    // result is the user's response
    console.log(result);
}, options);

The possible options (Object) when creating dialogs are the following:

  • position (Array): [x, y] representing left-top values relative to the main LX root area.
  • size (Array): [width, height] in css
  • draggable (Boolean): Set the pop-up as draggable. In case of pocket dialogs it's false, by default (they are dockables)
